page.title: 04Saxonbury Wood,East Sussex
page.content: Saxonbury Wood is an area of mainly deciduous woodland covering about 50 hectares. The most common trees are Birch,Beech,and Sweet Chestnut. Oak, Holly,Yew,Hazel,Rowan and Scots Pine also grow there.In the wood there are earthworks made before the coming of the Romans.These people were able to make and use iron tools.In the centre of the earthworks,surrounded by rhododendrons, is a folly.It was built by the workmen of the 2nd.Earl of Abergavenny.There are sandstone outcrops and a stream.The wood is used for the rearing and shooting of pheasants.Part of the wood is used for the coppicing of Sweet Chestnut.
